column4: gnea: nope just an old ibm thinkpad laptop, the thing is there are ways to get the bios password removed but require paying someone else to do it and I mean come on i have been on ubuntu and linux for a year, i refuse to go back to the windows ideology of paying to get something down in the computer world, thats why smart people made linux because it is free and teaches people how to really use computers
gnea: i tried merlin doesn't work as backdoor bios password
- pop it open and pull the cmos battery
did that already in fact it has not had the cmos battery in it for over months
